page.title: 05SCHOOL LIFE
page.content: The original old{Victorian School building which is on Victoria hill was for the Infants and Juniors. They shared the same school building until 1969, when a new school was opened at {Ridgemede}with lovely big playing fields and this became the local {Junior School. The first headmaster, who is still here today, is Mr John Watts. Over the years the school has gradually taken more pupils and today there are approximately 270 children and several temporary huts for extra classrooms. The school has a fine{swimming pool which was built in 1979. In 1986 a new{Infants School}is going to be built behind Ridgemede School so we will be Juniors and Infants once again on the same site.
